sentences.english: Some photos were of beauty queens in evening gowns or other high-status clothing.
sentences.chinese: 有些照片是身着晚禮服或者其他顯貴衣服的選美皇后。

sentences.english: By the time the dignitaries had filed out, it was too late.
sentences.chinese: 當這些高官顯貴魚貫而出之後，一切都太晚了。

sentences.english: The notables then went away, and on the third day they all came with shaved heads.
sentences.chinese: 宴會散了，可第三天那些名人顯貴都剃了光頭來赴宴。

sentences.english: People in the street, ask crew-cut dignitaries asked in temple.
sentences.chinese: 平頭百姓求於街頭，達官顯貴問於廟堂。

sentences.english: You know what these English grandees are. They're all alike.
sentences.chinese: 你知道這些英國顯貴的德性，他們全都一樣。

sentences.english: Like many leaders and men of power, Canute was surrounded by people who were always praising him.
sentences.chinese: 克努特國王周圍的高官顯貴總是在不停地頌揚他。

sentences.english: Kind hearts are more than coronets.
sentences.chinese: 善良的心靈勝於顯貴的地位。

sentences.english: But he was a commoner, not part of an important family.
sentences.chinese: 但他是一介布衣，而非死於顯貴之家。

sentences.english: The Duke of Chengqingwang can be counted as the most prestigious person in court at that time.
sentences.chinese: 成親王算得上是當時朝延裏最顯貴的人。

definition: offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to appreciate/to take pleasure in/to enjoy
Laiyang county level city in Yantai 煙台|烟台, Shandong
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
